recommended_treatment: Per NCCN guidelines for Stage IA, grade 2, endometrioid endometrial cancer without LVSI: observation (surveillance) or vaginal brachytherapy.
description: Hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy revealed a FIGO grade 2 endometrioid adenocarcinoma limited to the endometrium with <50% myometrial invasion, no lymphovascular invasion, and negative pelvic and para-aortic lymph nodes (pT1a N0).
patient_notes: Your surgery removed a low-grade cancer confined to the lining of the uterus and showed no spread to lymph nodes or other tissues. This is an early stage (Stage IA) cancer with a very good prognosis. Based on guidelines, you may only need careful follow-up or a small targeted radiation treatment to the vaginal cuff. We will discuss these options and support you through monitoring and any additional care as needed.

verification.assessment: The extraction accurately captures the key oncologic details, staging, and guideline-based recommendation. All fields align with the report and NCCN guidance.
